div.p: This case-insensitive code system http://smart.who.int/ig/smart-immunizations/CodeSystem/IMMZ.D1 defines the following codes:

tr.td: Indicates if the client received a dose within 24 hours of birth. Whether a birth dose is counted as part of the primary series will depend on the antigen.
The type of dose in a series that the client received
Indicates that the client received the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. This is also applicable for antigens with one dose.
Indicates that the client received a dose of a product/ antigen within 24 hours of birth. This dose is not a part of the primary vaccination series.
Indicates that the client received a supplementary dose of a product/antigen
Indicates that the client received booster dose of a product/antigen

Indicates if the client has completed the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. If the client has not yet completed their primary series, it means they may be expected to receive more doses to complete their vaccination regimen for the respective product/antigen.
Indicates if the client has completed the booster series of a product/antigen
Date when primary vaccination series was completed
The date when the client completed the primary vaccination series (per product/antigen)
The current human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) status of the client
The client is known to be HIV positive
The client is known to be HIV negative
The client's HIV status is unknown
The infant was preterm; the mother gave birth to the infant when gestational age was less than 37 weeks
The client is known to be immunocompromised. This means the client has a weakened immune system and having a reduced ability to fight infections and other diseases
The client is currently receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART)
Type of TB infection test performed
The type of TB infection test performed
Records the result of the TB infection test
The client is living with HIV and is immunologically stable with CD4 count or percentage above a minimum as defined in the HIV guidelines
The client is living with HIV and is clinically well, as defined in HIV guidelines and WHO clinical staging
Represents the client's birth weight value measures in grams
The type of the polio vaccine dose administered to the client
The client is known to be severely immunosuppressed
The date on which the client started or restarted antiretroviral therapy (ART)
The client is at high risk for pneumococcal infection because of underlying medical conditions (i.e. HIV infection or sickle-cell disease)
The type of Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine dose administered to the client
Inactivated Vero cell-derived Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine type
Live attenuated Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine type
Live recombinant Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine type
The type of tick-borne encephalitis (TBE) vaccine dose administered
FSME-Immun vaccine product, which is an inactivated whole-virus vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
Encepur vaccine product, which is an inactivated viral vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
TBE-Moscow vaccine product, which is a vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
EnceVir vaccine product, which is a vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
The type of typhoid vaccine dose administered to the client
The type of cholera vaccine dose administered to the client
Killed whole cell (WC) only cholera vaccine
Vaccine contains a mixture of the recombinant B subunit (rBS) of cholera toxin plus killed whole cell (WC)
The type of meningococcal vaccine dose administered to the client
Monovalent serogroup A (MenA) conjugate vaccine (5µg) vaccine
Polysaccharide vaccines not including polysaccharide-protein conjugate vaccines
Age in months when client received first meningococcal dose
The age in months when client received their first meningococcal dose
The type of hepatitis A vaccine dose administered to the client
The type of hepatitis B vaccine dose administered to the client

Vaccine-induced neutralizing (VNA) antibody level. It is a measured as a serum antibody concentration amount observed from the result of the concentrated, purified cell culture and embryonated egg-based rabies vaccines (CCEEV)
Risk of occupational exposure to rabies virus
Professional at risk of occupational exposure to rabies virus, particularly animal health-care workers. Also considered for medical professionals who regularly provide care to persons with rabies.
Indicates the result of a serological test determining whether the client has antibodies against the dengue virus
The client has detectable antibodies against the dengue virus, suggesting past exposure or vaccination
The client does not have detectable antibodies, indicating no previous exposure or vaccination against the dengue virus
The client's dengue serostatus is unknown

definition.value: Indicates if the client received a dose within 24 hours of birth. Whether a birth dose is counted as part of the primary series will depend on the antigen.
The type of dose in a series that the client received
Indicates that the client received the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. This is also applicable for antigens with one dose.
Indicates that the client received a dose of a product/ antigen within 24 hours of birth. This dose is not a part of the primary vaccination series.
Indicates that the client received a supplementary dose of a product/antigen
Indicates that the client received booster dose of a product/antigen

Indicates if the client has completed the primary vaccination series of a product/antigen. If the client has not yet completed their primary series, it means they may be expected to receive more doses to complete their vaccination regimen for the respective product/antigen.
Indicates if the client has completed the booster series of a product/antigen

display.value: Date when primary vaccination series was completed

definition.value: The date when the client completed the primary vaccination series (per product/antigen)
The current human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) status of the client
The client is known to be HIV positive
The client is known to be HIV negative
The client's HIV status is unknown
The infant was preterm; the mother gave birth to the infant when gestational age was less than 37 weeks
The client is known to be immunocompromised. This means the client has a weakened immune system and having a reduced ability to fight infections and other diseases
The client is currently receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART)

display.value: Type of TB infection test performed

definition.value: The type of TB infection test performed
Interferon-gamma release assay (IGRA)
Tuberculin skin test (TST)
Records the result of the TB infection test
Test result was positive
Test result was negative
The client is living with HIV and is immunologically stable with CD4 count or percentage above a minimum as defined in the HIV guidelines
The client is living with HIV and is clinically well, as defined in HIV guidelines and WHO clinical staging
Represents the client's birth weight value measures in grams
The type of the polio vaccine dose administered to the client
Inactivated poliovirus vaccine (IPV)
Bivalent oral poliovirus vaccine (bOPV)
The client is known to be severely immunosuppressed
The date on which the client started or restarted antiretroviral therapy (ART)
The client is at high risk for pneumococcal infection because of underlying medical conditions (i.e. HIV infection or sickle-cell disease)
The type of Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine dose administered to the client
Inactivated Vero cell-derived Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine type
Live attenuated Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine type
Live recombinant Japanese encephalitis (JE) vaccine type
The type of tick-borne encephalitis (TBE) vaccine dose administered
FSME-Immun vaccine product, which is an inactivated whole-virus vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
Encepur vaccine product, which is an inactivated viral vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
TBE-Moscow vaccine product, which is a vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
EnceVir vaccine product, which is a vaccine for tick-borne encephalitis (TBE)
The type of typhoid vaccine dose administered to the client
Typbar-TCV vaccine
Vi polysaccharide (ViPS) vaccine
Ty21a vaccine
The type of cholera vaccine dose administered to the client
Killed whole cell (WC) only cholera vaccine
Vaccine contains a mixture of the recombinant B subunit (rBS) of cholera toxin plus killed whole cell (WC)
The type of meningococcal vaccine dose administered to the client
Monovalent serogroup A (MenA) conjugate vaccine (5µg) vaccine
Monovalent MenC conjugate vaccine
Quadrivalent conjugate (A,C,W135,Y-D and A,C,W135,Y-CRM) vaccines
Polysaccharide vaccines not including polysaccharide-protein conjugate vaccines

display.value: Age in months when client received first meningococcal dose

definition.value: The age in months when client received their first meningococcal dose
The type of hepatitis A vaccine dose administered to the client
Live attenuated hepatitis A vaccine
Inactivated hepatitis A vaccine
The type of hepatitis B vaccine dose administered to the client
Hepatitis B monovalent vaccine
Hepatitis B combination vaccine

Vaccine-induced neutralizing (VNA) antibody level. It is a measured as a serum antibody concentration amount observed from the result of the concentrated, purified cell culture and embryonated egg-based rabies vaccines (CCEEV)

display.value: Risk of occupational exposure to rabies virus

definition.value: Professional at risk of occupational exposure to rabies virus, particularly animal health-care workers. Also considered for medical professionals who regularly provide care to persons with rabies.
Indicates the result of a serological test determining whether the client has antibodies against the dengue virus
The client has detectable antibodies against the dengue virus, suggesting past exposure or vaccination
The client does not have detectable antibodies, indicating no previous exposure or vaccination against the dengue virus
